step.name: Calculate AOV
step.text: Use the formula: Total Revenue / Total Number of Orders = Your AOV

step.name: Set Free Shipping Threshold
step.text: Set the threshold just a little higher than your current AOV to encourage larger orders

step.name: Create Product Bundles
step.text: Group related items into kits or packs for a slight discount to increase cart value

step.name: Implement Volume Discounts
step.text: Offer tiered discounts like 'Buy 2, get 10% off; Buy 3, get 20% off'

step.name: Add Upselling and Cross-selling
step.text: Show complementary items and premium versions during the shopping process

step.name: Use Post-Purchase Offers
step.text: Present one-time deals on the confirmation screen after payment

step.name: Analyze Customer Data
step.text: Use Shopify metrics to identify products customers buy together for bundle creation

mainEntity.name: Beyond a simple discount, what pricing strategy rewards customers for larger orders?

acceptedAnswer.text: A tiered pricing strategy is an effective approach. For example, offer increasing discount percentages or exclusive rewards as the customer's order value grows. This tactic encourages shoppers to add more items to achieve a better deal, directly improving results.

mainEntity.name: How can customer data and metrics inform effective AOV offers on Shopify?

acceptedAnswer.text: Use customer purchase data on your Shopify store to create personalized offers. Analyzing metrics helps identify products people frequently buy together, providing a data-driven choice for creating bundles or upsell strategies that resonate with specific buyers.

mainEntity.name: Which approach is better for consumers: a minimum order discount or product bundling strategies?

acceptedAnswer.text: While a discount is a good tactic, bundling strategies often provide more perceived value to consumers. This approach gives buyers a curated choice and a simple way to get more, often leading to better results than a simple minimum order goal.

@graph.name: Average Order Value (AOV)
@graph.description: The average dollar amount every single customer spends when they place an order

@graph.name: Product Bundling
@graph.description: Grouping related items into a kit or pack for a slight discount

@graph.name: Upselling
@graph.description: Convincing customers to buy the slightly better, more expensive version of the product they're looking at

@graph.name: Cross-selling
@graph.description: Suggesting complementary items, like showing a memory card and bag when someone buys a camera

@graph.name: Post-Purchase Offer
@graph.description: A one-time-only deal presented right after payment on the confirmation screen

@graph.name: Customer Lifetime Value (CLV)
@graph.description: The long-term value a customer brings to your business over their entire relationship

@graph.name: Return on Ad Spend (ROAS)
@graph.description: A metric that measures revenue generated for every dollar spent on advertising
